comment:
* Error codes from update engine upon finishing a call to
     * {@link applyPayload}. Values will be passed via the callback function
     * {@link UpdateEngineCallback#onPayloadApplicationComplete}. Values must
     * agree with the ones in {@code system/update_engine/common/error_code.h}.

variables.name: SUCCESS
variables.comment: * Error code: a request finished successfully.

variables.name: ERROR
variables.comment: * Error code: a request failed due to a generic error.

variables.name: FILESYSTEM_COPIER_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to filesystem copier
         * error.

variables.name: POST_INSTALL_RUNNER_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to an error in running
         * post-install hooks.

variables.name: PAYLOAD_MISMATCHED_TYPE_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to a mismatching payload. * *

For example, the given payload uses a feature that's not * supported by the current update engine.

variables.name: INSTALL_DEVICE_OPEN_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to an error in opening
         * devices.

variables.name: KERNEL_DEVICE_OPEN_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to an error in opening
         * kernel device.

variables.name: DOWNLOAD_TRANSFER_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to an error in fetching * the payload. * *

For example, this could be a result of bad network connection * when streaming an update.

variables.name: PAYLOAD_HASH_MISMATCH_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to a mismatch in payload * hash. * *

Update engine does sanity checks for the given payload and its * metadata.

variables.name: PAYLOAD_SIZE_MISMATCH_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to a mismatch in payload
         * size.

variables.name: DOWNLOAD_PAYLOAD_VERIFICATION_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to failing to verify
         * payload signatures.

variables.name: PAYLOAD_TIMESTAMP_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update failed to apply due to a downgrade in payload * timestamp. * *

The timestamp of a build is encoded into the payload, which will * be enforced during install to prevent downgrading a device.

variables.name: UPDATED_BUT_NOT_ACTIVE
variables.comment:
* Error code: an update has been applied successfully but the new slot * hasn't been set to active. * *

It indicates a successful finish of calling {@link #applyPayload} with * {@code SWITCH_SLOT_ON_REBOOT=0}. See {@link #applyPayload}.

variables.name: NOT_ENOUGH_SPACE
variables.comment:
* Error code: there is not enough space on the device to apply the update. User should * be prompted to free up space and re-try the update. * *

See {@link UpdateEngine#allocateSpace}.

variables.name: DEVICE_CORRUPTED
variables.comment:
* Error code: the device is corrupted and no further updates may be applied. * *

See {@link UpdateEngine#cleanupAppliedPayload}.
